intro: Aegiphila buchtienii, commonly known as the Buchtien's aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
